intro: Karwinskia umbellata, commonly known as the umbrella tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive umbrella-like inflorescence. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces showy, pink to purple flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Karwinskia umbellata is also valued for its ability to tolerate a range of soil conditions.
